question: show me monthly sales trends

answer.text: Here's the monthly sales trend analysis:
answer.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv('data/DimSumDelight_Full.csv')
df['order_time'] = pd.to_datetime(df['order_time'])
df['month'] = df['order_time'].dt.to_period('M')
monthly_sales = df.groupby('month')['order_value'].sum()

plt.figure(figsize=(10,5))
monthly_sales.plot(kind='line', marker='o', color='#00B14F')
plt.title('Monthly Sales Trend')
plt.xlabel('Month')
plt.ylabel('Sales ($)')
plt.grid(True)

question: what are top selling items by revenue

answer.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv('data/DimSumDelight_Full.csv')
top_items = df.groupby('item_name')['order_value'].sum().nlargest(5)

plt.figure(figsize=(10,5))
top_items.plot(kind='barh', color='#00B14F')
plt.title('Top 5 Items by Revenue')
plt.xlabel('Total Revenue ($)')
plt.ylabel('Item Name')
plt.gca().invert_yaxis()

question: show me average delivery times by city

answer.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv('data/DimSumDelight_Full.csv')
df['delivery_duration'] = (pd.to_datetime(df['delivery_time']) - pd.to_datetime(df['order_time'])).dt.total_seconds()/60
city_times = df.groupby('city_id')['delivery_duration'].mean().sort_values()

plt.figure(figsize=(10,5))
city_times.plot(kind='bar', color='#00B14F')
plt.title('Average Delivery Time by City')
plt.xlabel('City ID')
plt.ylabel('Minutes')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
answer.insight: Fastest city is {city_times.idxmin()} with {city_times.min():.1f} min average

question: show me merchant join dates distribution

answer.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv('data/DimSumDelight_Full.csv')
df['join_date'] = pd.to_datetime(df['join_date'])
df['join_quarter'] = df['join_date'].dt.to_period('Q')
quarterly_joins = df.groupby('join_quarter')['merchant_id'].nunique()

plt.figure(figsize=(10,5))
quarterly_joins.plot(kind='area', color='#00B14F', alpha=0.5)
plt.title('New Merchants by Quarter')
plt.xlabel('Quarter')
plt.ylabel('New Merchants')
answer.insight: Peak acquisition quarter was {quarterly_joins.idxmax().strftime('Q%q %Y')} with {quarterly_joins.max()} new merchants
answer.additional_answer: I can check merchants with join_date containing '2023' in their records.
